DataElement.preferredName: Patient Childbearing Potential Pregnancy Avoidance And Unintended Pregnancy Risk Factor Advising Discussion Documentation Signed Informed Consent Code Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response that indicates whether the female patient with the potential to become pregnant signed the informed consent documenting the discussion and advisement of pregnancy avoidance, and risk factors for unintended pregnancies.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Childbearing Potential Pregnancy Avoidance And Unintended Pregnancy Risk Factor Advising Discussion Document Signature Informed Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._An indicator as to whether the female subject has the potential to become pregnant._The state or condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body (uterus), after union of an ovum and spermatozoon, during the period from conception to birth._A conscious or unconscious refusal to encounter situations, activities, or objects; the act or practice of keeping away from or withdrawing from something._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._A pregnancy that was not desired or was timed incorrectly at the time that the conception occurred._Something that increases the chance of developing a disease. Some examples of risk factors for cancer are age, a family history of certain cancers, use of tobacco products, being exposed to radiation or certain chemicals, infection with certain viruses or bacteria, and certain genetic changes._The act of giving information, suggestion, or recommendation to a group or individual._An extended communication (often interactive) dealing with some particular topic._A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable._Individual's name or personal mark, used to sign documents and employed to signify that the writing which precedes accords with one's wishes and intentions; having a handwritten signature._Consent by a patient to a surgical or medical procedure or participation in a clinical study after achieving an understanding of the relevant medical facts and the risks involved.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Childbearing Potential Pregnancy Avoidance And Unintended Pregnancy Risk Factor Advising Discussion Document Signature Informed Consent
Property.preferredDefinition: An indicator as to whether the female subject has the potential to become pregnant.:The state or condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body (uterus), after union of an ovum and spermatozoon, during the period from conception to birth.:A conscious or unconscious refusal to encounter situations, activities, or objects; the act or practice of keeping away from or withdrawing from something.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:A pregnancy that was not desired or was timed incorrectly at the time that the conception occurred.:Something that increases the chance of developing a disease. Some examples of risk factors for cancer are age, a family history of certain cancers, use of tobacco products, being exposed to radiation or certain chemicals, infection with certain viruses or bacteria, and certain genetic changes.:The act of giving information, suggestion, or recommendation to a group or individual.:An extended communication (often interactive) dealing with some particular topic.:A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.:Individual's name or personal mark, used to sign documents and employed to signify that the writing which precedes accords with one's wishes and intentions; having a handwritten signature.:Consent by a patient to a surgical or medical procedure or participation in a clinical study after achieving an understanding of the relevant medical facts and the risks involved.

Concepts.definition: An indicator as to whether the female subject has the potential to become pregnant.
The state or condition of having a developing embryo or fetus in the body (uterus), after union of an ovum and spermatozoon, during the period from conception to birth.
A conscious or unconscious refusal to encounter situations, activities, or objects; the act or practice of keeping away from or withdrawing from something.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
A pregnancy that was not desired or was timed incorrectly at the time that the conception occurred.
Any aspect of an individual's life, behavior, an environmental exposure, or an inborn or inherited characteristic that increases the likelihood of a disease, condition or injury.
The act of giving information, suggestion, or recommendation to a group or individual.
An extended communication (often interactive) dealing with some particular topic.
A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.
Individual's name or personal mark, used to sign documents and employed to signify that the writing which precedes accords with one's wishes and intentions; having a handwritten signature.
Consent by a patient to a surgical or medical procedure or participation in a clinical study after achieving an understanding of the relevant medical facts and the risks involved.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient is woman of childb
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is woman of childbearing potential, has patient been advised of the importance of avoiding pregnancy during study participation and the potential risk factors for an unintentional pregnancy and consent documenting this discussion has been signed?
